About MetaMask

We‚Äôre building for a future where the internet and world economy empowers people, instead of treating people like a product. Where our interactions are based on consent, privacy, and people freely associating with one another. Where communities can flourish and individuals can pursue their dreams. MetaMask is both a blockchain wallet and a gateway to the entire decentralized web. We exist across multiple platforms (browser extension and mobile), and we serve the whole decentralized ecosystem.

We're Hiring for MetaMask Core

One defining aspect of engineering at MetaMask is that we don‚Äôt maintain servers or databases. All of our users data is stored either locally on device or on the blockchain. Meanwhile, real time updates to data that is rendered to the user depends on our connection with external sources that draw from on-chain data.

Managing data in this context is a unique and interesting challenge. The need for data integrity, security and privacy is very high within a wallet. To meet this need, we build and maintain MetaMask Controllers, a ‚ÄúCollection of platform-agnostic modules for creating secure data models for cryptocurrency wallets‚Äù.

MetaMask Controllers is the data management layer at the core of our browser extension and mobile app code. Currently, all of mobile‚Äôs functionality and a large amount of the extension‚Äôs functionality depends on this code. We are currently pursuing a goal of fully unifying this data management layer across mobile and extension.

Once we achieve this, we will grow MetaMask controllers into a ‚Äúwallet SDK‚Äù. This will be an internal product that will form the foundation of our extension and mobile products, our dapp API, as well as future products (e.g. a native Desktop Client).

We are looking for engineers to help build the core of MetaMask. This should be an exciting opportunity for engineers passionate about api design, data architecture, building javascript modules for other engineers, unit tests, code abstraction, wallet standardization and/or building SDKs.
